programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Finlay can hear some scary noises in the Nursery. Who is making the scary sounds?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy discovers his socks are in the washing machine! This makes him wonder how a washing machine knows what to do so he goes to Okido to find out… Messy is just about to land in Okido as usual when he is caught mid-air by Zam’s new camping invention: Camperbot! “Are we going camping?” asks Messy, still held upside down. Zoe and Felix excitedly tell Messy that they are going to test out Camperbot up on Giant Mountain. Felix and Zoe show Messy what Camperbot can do, but when Messy asks it for a sock sandwich it replies that it is “not programmed” to do that… “Not programmed?!” mimics Messy, questioningly.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy has just woken up and is looking for his sock breakfast, but it is under his toy box and he can’t reach, or move it… He needs to know how to move heavy things, and the best place to find out the answer is Okido! When he arrives Zoe and Felix are also trying to move a heavy box! They need to go to the recycling centre today. So they all go to Zam and Zim to find out the best way to do it. Zim, Zam and Zoom are sunbathing and enjoying Zam’s latest invention when the three arrive.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When the girls discover that Apples groove booties can teach the pups to dance, Plum gets an idea for a Doggie Dance Show. Wanting to impress them, Huck offers to have TomTom join the show... despite the pups obvious dislike of performing in public. Its up to Strawberry to help Huck see that he should not force TomTom into something he just doesnt want to do.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry cant find one of his red cowboy socks - the ones with a white fringe.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Charlie lends Harry her Sergeant Shout toy for the weekend, Harry promises not to let it leave in his bedroom.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: At the base of the Andes Mountain, Peyo concocts a berry dip while Pico brings berries to him. Hearing a distressed animal, he finds an animal trapped inside a cave with its entrance blocked by a fallen tree. In the Garden, a duckling follows Hero around which Hero reacts by hiding behind Leo. They receive a call from Peyo and identify the animal as a Guanaco through the computer. With PlatypusOne, they reach the mountain, use a winch to free the Guanaco, discovering its a chulengo - a young guanaco. The chulengo follows Peyo closely, much to Peyo’s confusion. They decide that the chulengo should be with its family but they’re unsure how to transport it as it is afraid of PlatypusOne. Dumbfounded, they stumble upon Ranger Rocky who seeks Ranger Joeys advice. Ranger Joey explains Guanaco social structures and adaptations. The chulengo nudges Peyo which causes him to trip over a stone and a few herbs fall off from his satchel - which the chulengo eats up. This triggers an idea from Katie and the team uses Peyo’s herb to get it to follow PlatypusOne up the mountain to find its family. On the mountains peak, they find other Guanacos grazing and they reunite the chulengo with its group. Back at the Treehouse, a picture of the guanaco herd is hung, marking another successful mission. In the garden, Hero befriends the duckling, but it rejoins its mother.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets two wood-burning engines whove never travelled beyond their eucalyptus railway. Thomas agrees to swap jobs with them for the day, but this causes more trouble than he expects.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a pretend emergency quickly becomes a real one, its up to Emily to think on her wheels and solve a big problem.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has promised Mr. Toramento to help him clean up the beach. The problem is that he has more important things to do, like taking the fire truck ride that David promised him. Or even more urgently, helping his firefighting heroes find the fire truck keys that David lost. So, he messes up his work, until he realizes that its better to do things right. At the end he eventually finds the keys and gets his fire truck ride.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu wants to set up a special birthday party for Fume at the pizzeria, and to offer him his favorite pizza. Unfortunately, Mr. Guellec has hurt his arm and he cant harvest the tomatoes that the pizza sauce requires. With Stellas help, Grisu turns into a farmer but its not an easy task to harvest Guellecs high tomato plants for such a tiny dragon. Fortunately, Grisu has plenty of ideas: if you cant reach the tomatoes, try to make the tomatoes reaching you!And after having burnt the cart he needs to deliver the tomatoes in time, Grisu finds a way to achieve his mission by creating the first rolling catamaran!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Wilson have to load their cars with special blocks and bring them back to Vee without dropping any or leaving any behind. They think this is the easiest badge ever – until they see that the blocks are oddly shaped and won’t all fit into the cars! Eventually they realise that if they slot the blocks together to make cubes, they fit into the cars perfectly. They deliver the load to Vee and earn their badges!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie talks too much. She has told the twins that her best friend, Biva, is going to meet Loudo. The two brothers are extremely excited at the news and decide to spy on the two children. This is a catastrophe for Rosie - unless…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: While working at Fixham Campsite, Dizzy wants to camp out with Leo and the Spring City Rockets till she’s put off by the creepy crawlies. She later regrets her decision and returns with Scoop and Muck but they are frightened by the spooky story Leo is telling and the Rockets think they are the creatures from his story. Everyone panics and the build is damaged as they flee. Dizzy gets her wheel stuck in a ditch and is left behind.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Sports guru Skye Sampson asks Bob to build a 100 metre zip-line for her new fitness program. Its a job that Leo should love to help with, but he seems very distracted. Leo is put in charge of finishing the launch platform and fixing the zip-line, but he keeps making mistakes and wonders if he is up to the job. Lofty tries to convince Leo of how well theyre doing, but when the zip-line comes loose its the last straw. Leo says he should give up being a builder. Scoop and Lofty panic that Leo is going to leave the team – they decide they must make things right! But in their attempts to fix the platform they end up demolishing it instead.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: When a Sunda slow loris lands in the garden, the Junior Rangers quickly learn that they have to return it to the wild. Will they manage to find the slow loris a home? Or will the slow loris end up as a snack for a hungry sun bear?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Join the Junior Rangers as they race across the tundra to reunite a lost reindeer calf with its herd. However, a river crossing might prove too tiring for the young reindeer.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is very excited about the idea of seeing lots of animals when he goes on a school outing with his class, but all he finds on the trip at first is rain and a beetle!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda and Rupert are on a boat trip when they suddenly find themselves stranded on dry land. Where has the water gone? They meet Berta, the beaver girl, and discover her dam is the cause.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The whole family goes off on their bikes for a ride to the lake for a picnic. Simon is ecstatic, he pedals off super-fast. But then he reaches a hill, which is too hard to negotiate. He has to get off his bike and push it up the hill. Pfffff, bummer. Going down the other side only lifts his spirits for a short beat because now he has a flat tire. Simon is even more bummed now.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A swim in the garden brings Leo and Hero up close and personal with a Malayan water monitor. The Junior Rangers set out to search for the monitor’s home, but will their jeep survive a river crossing after a jeep float gets punctured?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster must keep to a schedule picking up passengers. Koko is too eager and gets ahead of schedule, while Brewster is too cautious and gets behind schedule – but in the end, they both learn to run on time!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster is assigned to look after Ebo the elephant while some work is done on his enclosure. He decides to show Ebo where he lives. Ebo likes it at the depot because there is a pond to play in and he loves the chug wash. When it’s time to go home, Ebo doesn’t want to go back to the Safari Park. With Koko’s help, Brewster tricks him into the car, and returns Ebo to the park. Ebo is unhappy – until he sees the new water feature, that’s been built for him to play in!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! Dad asks them to leave the babies alone as they need peace and quiet in order to grow. But the two friends go to see Ciboulette and her adorable kittens over and over, behind Dad’s back. Until… all the cats go missing!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: This morning, Charley is late for school: all the doors are locked! The Headmaster arrives and reminds him that his classmates have already left for the forest for a treasure hunt. And its the Headmaster himself who offers to take Charley with the rest of the class, but the little boy panics: hes going into the forest with the Headmaster! And what if they dont find their friends? .

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The magic show that Dr. Spotty was about to perform tonight is cancelled. Julia is so disappointed that Sam decides to invent something instead. But how could he impress Julia as much as a magician?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma offers Sam and Julia a curious calendar representing the Mouse Mansion, each numbered window revealing an apartment the way it was long ago when its inhabitant first arrived.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while repairing an embankment, Marion strikes something hard and insists it must be the mast of a Viking Ship. It looks like a water pipe to Thomas but Marion is adamant that it isn’t. But the next day Thomas notices flooding near the bank and then there is a landslip and Marion has to admit her mistake and help prevent an accident.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Percy misses his friend Gator and keeps thinking back to the times they had together. It’s making him sad, so the other engines advise him to keep himself busy to take his mind off it. So Percy rushes about trying to keep busy, and ends up losing control of some trucks which roll into an old mine. Percy is frightened to go in after them, until he remembers Gator again and what Gator taught him about being brave!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Sheriff Caillou rides into action to stop an outlaw from robbing the bank!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Clementine visit the arcade and play different games!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is lying on the ground with orange floating devices. When Parrot asks what he is up to, Monkey explains that he is practicing for the world Floating championship but when he does it in the water he always sinks. Mole appears and tells them about Alligators impressing floating abilities and they decide to go to the lake and pay him a visit.eir natural habitats through engaging song and dance.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Its cold weather and Monkey has made a banana peel scarf for Parrot but that is not very warming or comfortable. Mole appears and tells them about sheep and her famously warm wool. Monkey feels that it would be the perfect textile to use and so they fly off to the farm. Watching her inspires monkey to invite Sheep to a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: James has discovered Bella Lasagne’s old pizza recipes and starts to bake pizzas in the Whole Fish Cafe. Everyone is really impressed the recipe is fantastic!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Tensions arise when Franklin and Beaver play the super hero team of Dynaroo and Gadgetio Koala. When they learn to co-operate like their comic book heroes they finally manage to save the day. /Franklin is frustrated when Harriet can’t keep up with the game of Space Guys. After carefully explaining the rules to her, the game goes much better.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Margaret is teaching orienteering to the children. And to put into practice what they have just learned, she has organized an orienteering course, to be played in teams. Scoutbadger, Rosie and Pico are in the same team, the red one. The badger isn’t happy about being with Pico, whom he believes to be too slow and a little wimpy. Scoutbadger is in it to win it! In his eyes, anorienteering course is a race.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What do you need for a great birthday? Doodleboo explains how to draw a birthday cake.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What doesnt have feathers and can fly silently like a bird? Doodleboo explains how to draw a ladybug.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: How to travel all around the world ? Doodleboo explains how to draw a flying saucer.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn some dance moves for a hoe-down on the farm. Hatty calls out the moves to help them all remember the order of the steps and they practice dancing together in line, in time to the music. When Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave dance at the hoe-down dance party, it’s so good everyone wants to join in!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave compete as ‘Team Hilltop’ against ‘Team Jungle’ in some fun sporting challenges. Dave throws well in the Banana-boomerang, Ruff-Ruff jumps high in the bamboo high jump and Tweet performs some fancy moves in the jungle gymnastics. But have they won enough points to beat their jungle friends? Or will victory rest on success in the final running relay?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.desc: When Santa discovers his magic clock that helps him get to all the children in time is broken, Noddy steps in to make sure the presents get delivered and Christmas is saved!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

They must find a way to re-inflate the balloons for the Big Balloon Parade, where Kate has a big surprise for Mim-Mim!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and her stuffed toy friends use their imaginations to go on wild and incredible adventures.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi leaves the gate to the goats pen unlatched, one of the baby goats goes missing! Finding out about it, he’s anxious it might get into difficulties while out on its own. Benedicte suggests they follow its trail of droppings to track it down. And so off they go on a goat dung treasure hunt through the forest!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: While playing against Tonio, Julia lost Sams beautiful marble. The two mice do everything to recover it, but Julia would like to understand why this marble was so precious to him...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Invited to dinner at Sams house, Julia makes a stain on the tablecloth while Sams mom is away. Time is running : can Sam and Julia wash the stain and fix Julias big mistake before the dinner?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda dreams of learning to fly. Excited by Robin Robins statement that anyone with wings can fly, Tilda makes herself some from lettuce leaves. Robin is supposed to give her flying instruction, but she gets bored with all the tedious theory. Molly gets Rupert to help persuade Tilda flying is a bad idea.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: It’s the night and The Triplets and Grandpa are at the beach to observe the night of the shooting stars. The Triplets are really really excited and ask a lot of questions to Grandpa. He explains to them that when you discover a new star you can name it after yourself, and when you see a shooting star you must make a wish. When they see their first shooting star, the Triplets wish for exactly the same thing, to have their own little star, The Triplet’s star!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: In Grandpa’s garden, Turbulent is fascinated by the super heroes’ stories he can read in his book. He wishes too to be a Kind Vigilante who saves the lovely and the helpless. Unfortunately, every time he tries to save someone, his sister who stucked her kite in a tree or his brother who is afraid of a spider for example, Grandpa always comes first and fixes the problem. When Turbulent was at the most discouraging point, a new villain appears ant kidnap all the people he loves, the Kind Vigilante is back in business!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund falls on the floor during the burrows big springcleaning. Nothing serious fortunately, but he needs to rest and take a day off. But he neither has time nor is used to rest! As ld get worse if he doesn’t keep his anklestill all day, Berry, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy do their best to make sure that their father rests without getting bored.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Its Caillous turn to take Gerald the class pet home, but when Caillou isnt careful, Gerald disappears!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: On a road trip to find homes for his van full of orphan puppies, Huckleberry gets lost near Berry Bitty City and is invited by Strawberry to spend the night—but ends up staying longer to repair the damage that his frisky pups do to the marketplace bedroom! programme.desc: Mommy and the Triplets are at the beach and the restless children ask for her attention all the time: Girl wants Mommy to see her sandpies, Poet needs her to inflate his armbands and Turbulent wants to play with her. Mommy has had enough, she needs a break ! The Triplets understand that being a Mom is not a piece of cake. To give their Mom a rest, they decide to play together but they soon get in trouble. Finally a break isnt a bad thing after all.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When Turbulent comes back with a balloon he got for free on the beach, Poet is jealous. But the balloon lady thinks its Turbulent coming back and refuses to give Poet the balloon hes asking for.She gives the same answer to Girl, thinking Turbulent is disguised. Enough is enough! The Triplets are sick and tired of people getting them mixed up, they want to be different. Maybe if Poet got fat or Girl changed her hair color, people would make the difference?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Hoot has had enough of his sister Toot! And Toot is tired of her brother Hoot!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Why Files (Norman and Hannah) investigate a mystery involving spilled milk, a half-eaten sausage roll, and strange ‘dog like’ footprints…

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and Dad are building derby cars to race on their homemade track. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and all their friends race their own cars in the Rip Roaring Race at the Rumbly Race Track. In everyone’s haste to win, Mim-Mim is the only one who tested his car beforehand. Lucky for his friends, Mim-Mim added some special parts!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate doesn’t understand why her flower is so much smaller than Mom’s. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim help their friends catch a surprise sapling seed—a speedy seed that sprouts in the most surprising way! The wiggly seed leads them on a wild underground pursuit in search of its ideal place to grow. But will it be worth the chase?

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou wants to play T-ball instead of helping his family with spring cleaning, a fantasy about being a player on a famous (but selfish) baseball team during the World Baseball Finals shows him that teamwork is the best approach.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou and Clementine find a tiger toy at school, they are reluctant to look for its owner and give it back. By pretending to be a safari guide who finds a baby tiger separated from his mother, Caillou realizes that it’s not right to keep things that don’t belong to you, no matter how much you love them.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks people should travel by bus instead of rail, and when he sees an accident at the construction site that pollutes the water tower, he does not tell anyone.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Oh no! Someone is stung by the Brazilian Yellow Scorpion!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo is stuck in a tree with an Anaconda hanging right above him. Can the Junior Rangers get to him in time?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats a bit nervous at meeting the Duchess of Pencaster! A very special delivery indeed!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must deliver a new cow to Alf, but Daisy has a habit of running away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald builds a nice simple birdhouse so that the birds can keep warm. His friends tell him to add things to the birdhouse - paint, flowers, bells - to make it more attractive, but in the end the birds prefer his simple birdhouse.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry wakes up with a long feather sticking up from his head. Oswald tells him to go to the barber, but Henry is afraid it will hurt, and he goes to great lengths - wearing a hat, sticking jam on his head - to avoid doing so. Finally, Oswald convinces him to go, and Henry finds out that getting a haircut isn’t so scary after all.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs commissions Bob and team to build Komodo Island with a walkway/bridge for the public to gain a better view of the Komodo Dragons. Muck discovers he is terrified of the Komodos so is set to work clearing out their old enclosure (without his knowledge) instead. When he discovers some eggs buried in the earth there he braves returning to the Island to ask Jenny what to do with them. But a Komodo hisses at him and Muck is spooked - he backs into part of the walkway causing it to collapse and leaving Leo dangling in mid air from a safety harness. When Muck sees the Komodo apparently climbing the tree to attack Leo he overcomes his fears to go back and save him.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s the Machine’s Check Up Day; a day when Curtis the mechanic comes to check their mechanics and engines are all working properly! Scoop boast he’s going to get ‘top marks’ for his check-up. Lofty is worried he won’t get any. After Scoop, Lofty and Muck have a Jet-Wash, Bob calls Curtis to tell him they’re ready but Scoop realises his orange emergency light is broken and thinks he won’t get ‘top marks’. He panics and decides to hide until Curtis has gone! Scoop scours the Yard for somewhere to hide – but in the process makes himself muddy again. Then he breaks the glass in his side mirror before tearing his rear tyre mud flap. Eventually Bob finds Scoop hiding behind a pile of cement bags, looking dishevelled and sorry for himself! Bob and Wendy ‘fix’ Scoop so he’s ready for his check-up. Lofty is still worried and nervous about being examined.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are learning about music. Can you guess what instruments they are playing?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy has just woken up and is looking for his sock breakfast, but it is under his toy box and he can’t reach, or move it… He needs to know how to move heavy things, and the best place to find out the answer is Okido! When he arrives Zoe and Felix are also trying to move a heavy box! They need to go to the recycling centre today. So they all go to Zam and Zim to find out the best way to do it. Zim, Zam and Zoom are sunbathing and enjoying Zam’s latest invention when the three arrive.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy walks into the bathroom and is horrified to find it clean! It’s not right for a Messy Monster at all. “Why do you have to clean things anyway?” He asks himself. And he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives Felix and Zoe are at the top of their treehouse and there is a noisy racket going on! They don’t know what it could be so they skidoodle to go and have a look. When they arrive in the centre of Okido there are funny little things making lots of noise hurtling around the streets and sending the Okidinians into chaos!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a simple tune Cherry composes goes viral on the Berryweb, Cherry quickly gets fed up with everyone listening to this song, everywhere, all the time. She goes to comic lengths to get some peace so she can compose the song shes suppose to write for the Queen of Berryvania.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry receives a box of magic tricks for Christmas but is unable to create any magic.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is scared of going to the dentist, but when Trike complains that his horn is sore Harry insists that Trike goes to the Horntist in Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah faces a perilous climb up the Caucasus Mountain, encountering an agitated East Caucasian Tur that leaves her stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo is attempting to break his own time record of climbing a tree but a call from Farah interrupts him. Farah fills them in on her dangerous situation so Leo, Katie, and Hero rush to her aid. Upon arrival, they rescue Farah but discover a distressed baby tur on another lower ledge on that same mountain. They try to get close to it but the protective mother tur charges to them, endangering herself at the edge of the mountaintop. They meet Ranger Rocky who calls up Ranger Joey to know more about the tur. With insights from Ranger Joey, they devise a plan using bilberry branches to lure the mother tur away, enabling Leo to safely rescue the stranded baby. The heartwarming reunion of turs at the mountains summit marks the success of their mission, celebrated with a photo in the treehouse. In the garden Hero, attempting to climb a tree branch, comically finds himself stuck and Leo slides down to save him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In India, Thomas encourages Shankar to enter a costume contest, but Shankar doesnt feel comfortable being in the spotlight.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia is delighted to be transporting an elephant to the animal park - but her passenger is less happy about it

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Professor Smeraldo, in the middle of a pyramid exploration, calls Fume to have some information about Thudnose, a pharaoh who was nicknamed The Dragon Pharaoh. Unfornutately, the video communication is not good and is quickly cut off. Grisù and Fume go to Egypt to give Smeraldo a hand. Unfortunately, they dont know how to get into the pyramid to meet him, so they have no other choice than find their way all by themselves, like Egyptologist. Grisu manages to use and decrypt the pharaohs secret motto. They finally find Smeraldo. Grisu helps him to overcome the final obstacle to eventually discover the marvelous sarcophagus of Thudnose!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu and Stella are wandering in the harbour eating an ice-cream. David arrives by car, he comes to see his friend Olivier, a sailor whose expedition has just fallen through. Olivier was supposed to go sailing and clear up the mystery of the “Mermaid pass” but his teammates have withdrawn at the last minute. Fortunately, Grisu can replace them.And here are Olivier and Grisu leaving on the planned expedition. But they didnt notice that Stella is also on board, locked in a closet in spite of herself.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: In order to earn his badge, Brewster has to invent a fun tour to teach a group of children a little about Chuggington. He decides to show them a Day in the Life of a Chugger – but his tour is so dull! To make matters worse, he accidentally loses his passengers. He finds them with Wilson, having a great time on the turntable. Realising that chuggers work hard, but that they have fun too, he takes his passengers on a ‘Laugh and Learn’ tour around the depot.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger has been invited to sleep over at Martis’s home and, for once, has to ask his father for permission instead of asking Margaret as he usually does. However, Margaret is not there today and Edmund is in a very bad mood.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Science and engineering hot shot Mei Moon has designed and built a rocket, named Stella. If successful Stella will become the smallest rocket ever to reach space. The Spring City Rockets have gathered and made a banner to celebrate and Bobs job is to finish building Stellas launch pad near the Observatory. Lofty is given the important task of lifting Stella onto the launch pad. Mei reminds him he has to be very careful, but he becomes flustered and tries to place the rocket before the launch pad is finished. Stella falls off and flops into wet concrete, ejecting her landing parachute, which Lofty accidentally runs over and rips. Now the launch is ruined. The team clean the concrete splattered rocket by using the machine wash back at the yard, but they still have the problem of the ripped parachute.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been busy building a new water park, “Spring City Splash” that includes a wave pool and splash zone. Now there is only one thing left to build... the double dragon water slide. Scoop loves dragons and cannot wait to help build the slides, but when he is asked to help build the support beams instead, he is less than impressed with his job. As Bob attaches the new water park entrance sign, Scoop digs foundations for the support beams. Suddenly Scoop becomes distracted with the arrival of the dragon slides and doesn’t finish the foundations. He attempts to see the dragon slides only to be sent back to finish his job. Now totally eager to get to the slides, Scoop rushes to complete his job and doesn’t realise that the support beams are not set and are beginning to lean.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A visit to the mangrove swamp is in order when Leo and Hero find a baby estuarine crocodile in the garden. Can the Junior Rangers find the baby crocodile’s nest while avoiding the adult crocodiles that roam the swamp?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a baby plantain squirrel eating his seed collection. The Junior Rangers drive to the forest to locate the squirrel’s nest and mother.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are throwing snowballs at each other, but Simon keeps dodging Gaspards snowballs and Gaspard keeps getting hit by Simons, so Mummy comes to Gaspards rescue!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you break a special thing, you can put it in the bye-bye box and it keeps it safe.Bing is having fun with a new orange balloon when he jumps on it and breaks it. Bing is upset because he broke his balloon, so Flop helps him place the recovered pieces in the bye-bye box, which contains irreparable objects that are too valuable to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too. They agree to let each other have turns by counting up to ten, but Pando wont count properly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing and Sula feed the ducks in the park, Sula stands quietly but Bing is boisterous.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Billy loses his baby tooth and places it under his pillow. He and Benny want to see the Tooth Fairy, so they stay awake. Eventually, they go out at night searching for her.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda Appleseed is overwhelmed by the many tasks in her guesthouse. But when she observes calm Snaily, she realizes that she can accomplish everything in a relaxed manner and one step at a time.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly stands trembling at Tildas door: last night she heard noises in the village shop and then found an empty tin can. Its bound to have been a hungry ghost making trouble! That night, Tilda, Rupert, Molly and Edna lie in wait in the village shop to catch the ghost red-handed.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: At the beach, Simon wants to try Leon’s kite. The older boy laughs, Ha ha!, he is sure that Simon will never manage to do figures in the sky with it. Yes he can, his grandfather taught him how to. Impressed by Simon’s aerial acrobatics with the kite, Leon is unable to himself and he even falls down when he is surprised by a crab. Leon is a bit mad now. And so he bets that Simon won’t be able to catch the crab!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Imagine Leo’s surprise when he realises that a piece of seaweed in his aquarium is actually a leafy seadragon! The Junior Rangers set forth to put the leafy seadragon back in Australian waters, but their mission changes course when they have to save leafy seadragons that have been washed ashore.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must devise a fitness routine. Wilson climbs on the train jack and has Lori move him up and down. But Lori points out that she is the only one getting a work out! When Wilson tries to move off the jack his wheels spin and spin and he discovers it’s the perfect ‘stationary bike’ for a chugger! He demonstrates his wheel work out and wins his badge

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees must learn to trust each other. One of them will close their eyes while the other guides them around. Koko is very good at leading Brewster around, but finds it hard to close her eyes and trust him to guide her. When she realises that Brewster won’t earn his badge if she doesn’t let him lead, her strong sense of friendship overrides her fear, Brewster guides her around successfully, and they both win their badges.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina and her father, who are preparing a delicious dessert with yummy blackberries from the woods, Tchoupi wants to make his own recipe from a forest ingredient. Easier said than done: chestnuts or mushrooms aren’t always easy to find… especially when there’s a greedy squirrel roaming nearby!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is pretending to Nina that he’s able to read… but loses track of the story he’s trying to tell. An idea suddenly springs to mind: why doesn’t he just make up the rest of the story, in real life?!... The only thing they need to make it complete is a little chick to play the hero of their adventure. But when catching it turns out to be a lot more difficult than they’d bargained for, they realize they may just be living the true adventure, in real time…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina’s drawing of a rainbow, Tchoupi lists out all the colors within it. When he gets it wrong, Nina suggests they turn it into a game and look for the various hues in Nature. Loving the idea, Mom suggests they go find the colors on the flowers and vegetables in the hamlet. Nina and Tchoupi come back in next to no time, mission accomplished! Recognizing their talent, Dad ups the stakes, setting them the challenge of spotting the rainbow colors… among the animals! Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The teacher has brought along her rabbit for her little schoolchildren to look after. She insists on one rule: his cage must always be well closed so that he doesnt run away. In the evening, before Medhis activity, Charley and Paulie decide to go and feed the rabbit so that he doesnt go hungry during the night. But Charley doesnt close the cage properly and the rabbit... disappears!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The triplets are hard to put to sleep. Just as hard as Sams dad was! says Grandma. The only thing that used to put him to sleep was an old mobile, but its completely out of order...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia and Sam must babysit Ben. A game of hide and seek is launched in the residence. But Sams little brother is so well hidden that he cant be found. Where could he be hiding?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Timothy warns Bill and Ben to use their coal sensibly when there is a shortage at the Clay Pits, but they choose not to listen to him and soon run out of fuel.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Spencer brings a Very Important Passenger from the mainland, he is so determined to be on time that he doesn’t notice he’s been sent down the wrong track. By the time he arrives at Knapford, he is very late indeed and the V.I.P. refuses to travel back with him. The other engines all compete to be chosen to take the V.I.P. back to the mainland, but rushing to do things quickly and showing off, only leads to confusion and delay. And Spencer ends up being given a second chance.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou joins the soccer team and learns how to be a supportive teammate.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou spends a day at the park and plays with a dog named Pepper!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkeys enormous pile of coconuts falls into parrot’s hammock and rips it. Monkey looks for a needle to fix it. Mole suggests going to Hedgehog, whose back is covered with prickly needle like spines. They fly off to the forest and meet the shy hedgehog who gives them a needle and plays a game of Monkey See Monkey Do with them.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey has designed a paper airplane, he boasts how this will be the fastest paper airplane ever. But when he throws it, the plane immediately falls to the ground. When they meet Eagle they are impressed by his keen eye site and fast flying as he spotted Monkeys paper plane on the ground and glides down to get it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While taking her class on a tour of the airport, Mrs Chen accidentally lifts off in FireSwift and it’s up to Norman to use his gaming skills to control the aircraft until the Rescue Team arrives!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin thinks that Aunt T has forgotten to put the present inside the big cardboard box that she sent him so he and his friends take the box to her house. Along the way, the group transforms the box into many great things, leading Franklin to conclude that the box was the present all along. / Franklin gets caught up helping out all his friends with a bunch of favors instead of flying his new model airplane as he’d planned. It’s only when he’s finally honest with them, and tells them what he really wants to do, that he gets to fly his plane. And even better, his appreciative friends all show up to help him.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. programme.title: Bing Bunny

Well he would too if he can only get it to stop… when he finally does succeed, Monkey invites Ostrich to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”! With Ostrich slowly showing them how, Monkey and the children learn to stretch and move their long necks, open and close their beaks, shake their tail feathers and of course, run just like Ostrich.

Kate and Mim-Mim must find the cure: merry berry bush berries. The bush will only release berries if they make it laugh, but Mim-Mim’s jokes aren’t funny. He’ll have to tickle its funny bone another way!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: A family camp-out in the backyard has Kate both excited and nervous—she’s never slept outside before. In Mimiloo, she and Mim-Mim find Boomer with a case of the hiccups! The only cure is to scare the hiccups away with a journey to Happy Hollow—a place that’s supposed to be full of spooky creatures! Will it work?

programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.desc: Sam has a toothache. His daddy goes to get Dr. Bobola, but Dan, his older brother, thinks the doctor is going to pull his tooth! To avoid this, Julia tries to takes care of Sam instead of the doctor.

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, Tilda opens her front door and cant believe her eyes: theres an egg in her front garden. While Tilda asks Robin Robin for tips on egg care, Molly distributes flyers in Wild Rose Lane to find the owner. After a while, the egg cracks open and a chick hatches. As at that moment Tilda is not at home, the chick thinks Molly is its mother.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Tomorrow is my birthday, claims Girl, but Poet and Turbulent disagree: No, mine! they both answer. Mom explains that Triplets have the same birthday. However, Grandpa has an idea: he takes them to the countryside and shows Girl a rose bush which he created especially for her, lends a little plane to Turbulent, as well as a spyglass to Poet. At first, they are each extremely happy...but it is a lot more fun to share your presents, right?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund tells the story of how, as a child, his father woke him up one morning before sunrise to show him the gift of dawn. Ever since then, Edmund wakes up very early every morning to enjoy it. Intrigued, Rosie, Berry, Scoutbadger and Woodsy ask to see the gift, but Edmund claims that they are still too little. They will have to wait one or two more years to know about it!

Eventually James apologises and the Fat Controller gives him some work to do, but when James discovers that he’s pulling waste trucks he starts sulking again and it is only when his friends help him laugh at himself that James finally manages to find a way to dowhat he has to do, and even enjoy it!

programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.desc: Blueberry invites Huck to return to Berry Bitty City to co-write a story with her to submit to an online mystery magazine. But as they write the story, Huck feels he isn’t contributing anything—Blueberry’s insistence on duplicating the style of Patti Persimmon dominates their story. Trouble ensues when Blueberry learns Huck is writing a song with Cherry. She thinks he has found a new writing partner he likes better than her.

The poor badger feels more and more useless, and eventually decides to give up the search…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

Kate leads the gang on a quest to restore colour to the cliffs and their friend.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: While Kate and Mom are looking after a box of kittens, the box tips and they run all over the house. In Mimiloo, a flurry of mitty kats have overtaken Lily and Boomer’s house! programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Excited for a day with Grandma, Caillou feels helpless when she arrives with a sprained ankle. In fantasy, Castaway Caillou tries to help a sick Rexy.
